Movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

Review: first full movie of 2023 (i’m halfway through fellowship of the ring extended edition). enjoyed this—some great performances by driver, cruz and woodley. appreciate the “slice of life” biopic here as opposed to a heavier handed “wikipedia style” biopic. some great driving scenes (but i’ll admit i wanted more of them despite that not being the point of the movie or whatever). for some reason though just felt like something was missing from making it a really great movie—but i cannot figure out what that missing piece is.

extremely good, and absolutely soul-crushing. zac efron is so great here; in fact, pretty much all the actors shine here. holt mccallany is perfect—insidious and grandiose as the patriarch Fritz—and Harris Dickinson (who i’d never seen in anything before) was a scene-stealer. perhaps the unsung performances of the movie was Maura Tierney as Doris Von Erich. a couple very powerful moments involving her:-Kevin asking to talk to her and her saying “that’s what your brothers are for” (or something…

one of the formative movies of my childhood. the mix of whimsy, non-sequitur comedy early on, bizarre set-pieces, pranks (both written in the script and by Wilder on the actors) and truly iconic lines give this movie a quality that i think is truly unique. Gene Wilder as Wonka is one of my favorite performances ever. he’s such a massive shithead to the obnoxious kids and parents while still being this mysterious, wondrous figure. only gene could’ve found that balance.

saw this and oppenheimer alone back to back same day. would do it again. started w this and loved it. just a delightful romp at the movies. movie star power on full display. always gonna love the GOS but may have to start a new thing of the ROB bc margot robbie is such a powerful movie star. quick “analysis” of some of the discourse around barbie: if you can’t buy into the campiness of the movie, ofc you will…
